passage_text: Golovkin holds the highest knockout percentage – 91.2% – in middleweight championship history and is said to have one of the hardest chins in modern boxing, having never been knocked down or knocked out in over 375 fights, either as a professional, amateur or in sparring. Golovkin successfully defended his WBA title for the 4th time and IBO title for the 1st when he took on and defeated Japan's Makoto Fuchigami, earning a TKO victory in the 3rd round. Both of these fights were broadcast on BoxNation, exposing Golovkin to British viewers who were impressed with his performances.

Gennady Golovkin was born on April 8, 1982, in the city of Karagandy in the Kazakh SSR, Soviet Union as one of four brothers to a Russian father who was a coal miner, and a Korean mother who was an assistant in a chemical laboratory. Golovkin successfully defended his WBA title for the 4th time and IBO title for the 1st when he took on and defeated Japan's Makoto Fuchigami, earning a TKO victory in the 3rd round. Both of these fights were broadcast on BoxNation, exposing Golovkin to British viewers who were impressed with his performances.

Gennady Golovkin who is a professional boxer was born on 8th April 1982. He is the native of Karaganda, Karagandy Providence, Kazakh SSR. Golovkin is of Russian and Korean descent. His father is a Russian and was a coal miner whereas his mother is a Korean and she was an assistant in chemical laboratory. As a child, he was named as Gennady Gennadyevich Golovkin. He is one among the four children to his parents. They were his older brother named Sergey and Vadim who pushed him into the ring. Both of his elder join Russian army when he was at the age of eight.

Gennady Gennadyevich Golovkin (Kazakh: геннадий геннадьевич головкин; born 8 April 1982) is a Kazakh professional boxer. He is the current, unified WBA (Super) , IBF, WBC (interim) and IBO middleweight champion, and is the fourth ranked pound for pound boxer by The Ring magazine. Golovkin successfully defended his WBA title for the 4th time and IBO title for the 1st when he took on and defeated Japan's Makoto Fuchigami, earning a TKO victory in the 3rd round. Both of these fights were broadcast on BoxNation, exposing Golovkin to British viewers who were impressed with his performances.
